Aug 24, 2018
Helpful (220)
"Coming to work here was the best decision ever."
Current Employee - Branch Manager in Austin, TX
Recommends
Positive Outlook
Approves of CEO
I have been working at Wells Fargo full-time for less than a year
Pros
The culture here is phenomenal. The message is all about how the people make the difference and the company is very focused on developing employees. 

The routines set in place to reinforce the behaviors are phenomenal. Resources available to leaders for improving coaching style are endless! They have even taken external leadership theories and incorporated those into the resources and training available. 

Highly...
Show More
Cons
Some systems are a bit antiquated, but to be honest I’d prefer that over flashy stuff that glitches out all the time. 

Time off is not very competitive, and it doesn’t increase with positions that have more responsibility, it only increases with years worked at the company. 

No fully comprehensive health plan, but they do offer a company funded HSA with one of the plans.
Helpful (220)
review_title: Coming to work here was the best decision ever.

Oct 29, 2019
"Personal Banker"
Former Employee - Anonymous Employee 
Recommends
No opinion of CEO
I worked at Wells Fargo full-time for more than 3 years
Pros
No "official" sales goals. Decent pay and benefits. Good database with product information along with a "back office" that can give you extra information regarding certain situations. Bonuses are mainly determined by customer service reviews. Overall great job if your coworkers and management are as dedicated to the job as you are.
Cons
Can be overwhelming at times due to specific customer situations. Quarterly/weekly meetings can become redundant. If management is bad and unwilling to improve behavior, it can create a toxic work environment.
Advice to Management
If you've been in the company for over 5+ years, learn to adapt to the new way of things. Be humble and listen to both bankers and tellers when they have ideas to improve branch/sales efficiency.
Helpful

Oct 29, 2019
"Good Company, Some Bad Management"
Former Employee - Lead Teller 
Recommends
I worked at Wells Fargo full-time for more than 3 years
Pros
Professional work environment, solid compensation and incentive program, great medical and 401K benefits, and awesome paid time off
Cons
People in positions of power sometimes abuse that power. You can have a really great and fulfilling experience or absolutely miserable depending on your branch and management team. "Sales" went away but sales pressure did not.
Advice to Management
Don't put so much pressure on employees to have awkward, forced conversations for the purpose of selling more products or getting more referrals. Customers are not dumb and know what is going on, it makes them feel uncomfortable too! Having someone looking over your shoulder with every interaction and telling them all the things they could improve on does not bolster morale or make them want to be better/improve.
Helpful

Pros
This company has treated me well and over 6 years has become my work family.
Decent benefits, good environment, overall amazing vision and values that the majority of us employees honor and hold as well. (There will always be some who don’t in every company)
A company that truly strives to improve.
Good training for operation jobs ( CSR)
Cons
Stress from being in media for negative reasons.
Lack of communication around some changes, seen an improvement over last 2 years however.
Advice to Management
Keep working to support employees. Be open to our ideas as we are already here and wanting to be with the company.

Oct 17, 2019
"Change for the better"
Former Employee - Product Manager in San Francisco, CA
Recommends
Positive Outlook
Disapproves of CEO
I worked at Wells Fargo full-time for more than 10 years
Pros
Stable work environment, work-life balance, most of the job is easy-paced and predictable. Offices in convenient urban areas. Diversity. Inclusivity.
Cons
More recently, obsessively focussed on risk and compliance. If you are one of those people who loves checks and balances, saying "wait a minute" to every business decision and a certain level of bureaucratic nonsense in all levels of operational activity, Wells is the place for you. If you are set out to change the world of banking, look elsewhere.
Advice to Management
Promote from within. And leave if you know you have no talent and little to offer.
Helpful
